mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, R. D. Coverte to John Augustine Washington III, 1844 October 14
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Coverte, R. D.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: R. D. Coverte writes from Brooklyn following a visit to Mount Vernon in which he got the impression that John Augustine did not want to become a planter. Coverte inquires if he can rent Mount Vernon and 500 surrounding acres for a fair price. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, with integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: John Augustine Washington III and Descendants Papers
